001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.radio;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.AbstractComponentService;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.ComponentType;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.factory.ComponentFactory;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.insertion.Insertion;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.log.LogUi;
008import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebDriver;
009import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart.SmartWebElement;
010import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.util.strategy.Strategy;
011import java.util.Arrays;
012import java.util.List;
013import org.openqa.selenium.By;
014
015/**
016 * Implementation of the {@link RadioService} interface, providing methods to select radio buttons,
017 * verify their state (enabled, selected, visible), and retrieve their text values. Extends
018 * {@link AbstractComponentService} to manage creation and retrieval of {@link Radio} instances.
019 *
020 * <p>This class delegates core functionality to an internally retrieved {@link Radio} instance,
021 * created for each specified {@link RadioComponentType}. Methods conform to the {@link RadioService}
022 * contract, ensuring a uniform approach to handling radio buttons across various UI designs.
023 *
024 * <p>All public methods handle operations such as checking button states, locating elements by
025 * container or locator, and selecting them by text or strategy. The {@code insertion} method also
026 * implements the {@link Insertion} interface for data
027 * insertion scenarios.
028 *
029 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
030 */
031public class RadioServiceImpl extends AbstractComponentService<RadioComponentType, Radio> implements RadioService {
032
033   private static final String SELECT_RADIO_WITH_TEXT_CONTAINER =
034         "Selecting radio button with text %s in container %s for radio component %s";
035   private static final String SELECT_RADIO_WITH_STRATEGY =
036         "Selecting radio button with strategy %s in container %s for radio component %s";
037   private static final String SELECT_RADIO_WITH_TEXT = "Selecting radio button with text %s for radio component %s";
038   private static final String SELECT_RADIO_WITH_LOCATOR =
039         "Selecting radio button with locator %s for radio component %s";
040
041   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_ENABLED_CONTAINER =
042         "Checking if radio button with text %s is enabled in container %s for radio component %s";
043   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_ENABLED_TEXT =
044         "Checking if radio button with text %s is enabled for radio component %s";
045   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_ENABLED_LOCATOR =
046         "Checking if radio button with locator %s is enabled for radio component %s";
047
048   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_SELECTED_CONTAINER =
049         "Checking if radio button with text %s is selected in container %s for radio component %s";
050   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_SELECTED_TEXT =
051         "Checking if radio button with text %s is selected for radio component %s";
052   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_SELECTED_LOCATOR =
053         "Checking if radio button with locator %s is selected for radio component %s";
054
055   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_VISIBLE_CONTAINER =
056         "Checking if radio button with text %s is visible in container %s for radio component %s";
057   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_VISIBLE_TEXT =
058         "Checking if radio button with text %s is visible for radio component %s";
059   private static final String CHECK_RADIO_VISIBLE_LOCATOR =
060         "Checking if radio button with locator %s is visible for radio component %s";
061
062   private static final String GET_SELECTED_RADIO_CONTAINER =
063         "Getting selected radio button text from container %s for radio component %s";
064   private static final String GET_SELECTED_RADIO_LOCATOR =
065         "Getting selected radio button text from locator %s for radio component %s";
066
067   private static final String GET_ALL_RADIOS_CONTAINER =
068         "Getting all radio buttons from container %s for radio component %s";
069   private static final String GET_ALL_RADIOS_LOCATOR =
070         "Getting all radio buttons from locator %s for radio component %s";
071
072   private static final String INSERT_RADIO_VALUES_LOCATOR =
073         "Inserting values %s for radio component %s using locator %s";
074
075   /**
076    * Constructs a new {@code RadioServiceImpl} with the provided {@link SmartWebDriver}.
077    *
078    * @param driver the smart web driver for interacting with browser elements.
079    */
080   public RadioServiceImpl(SmartWebDriver driver) {
081      super(driver);
082   }
083
084   /**
085    * Creates and returns a {@link Radio} component based on the given {@link RadioComponentType}.
086    *
087    * @param componentType the type of the radio component.
088    * @return a new or existing {@link Radio} instance for the specified component type.
089    */
090   @Override
091   protected Radio createComponent(final RadioComponentType componentType) {
092      return ComponentFactory.getRadioComponent(componentType, driver);
093   }
094
095   /**
096    * Selects a radio button by text within a given container, using the specified {@link RadioComponentType}.
097    *
098    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
099    * @param container       the container holding the radio buttons.
100    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to select.
101    */
102   @Override
103   public void select(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container,
104                      final String radioButtonText) {
105      LogUi.step(String.format(SELECT_RADIO_WITH_TEXT_CONTAINER, radioButtonText, container, componentType));
106      radioComponent(componentType).select(container, radioButtonText);
107   }
108
109   /**
110    * Selects a radio button within a given container using a custom {@link Strategy}, returning
111    * the text of the selected button.
112    *
113    * @param componentType the radio component type.
114    * @param container     the container holding the radio buttons.
115    * @param strategy      the selection strategy.
116    * @return the text of the selected radio button.
117    */
118   @Override
119   public String select(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container,
120                        final Strategy strategy) {
121      LogUi.step(String.format(SELECT_RADIO_WITH_STRATEGY, strategy, container, componentType));
122      return radioComponent(componentType).select(container, strategy);
123   }
124
125   /**
126    * Selects a radio button by text without specifying a container, using the given {@link RadioComponentType}.
127    *
128    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
129    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to select.
130    */
131   @Override
132   public void select(final RadioComponentType componentType, final String radioButtonText) {
133      LogUi.step(String.format(SELECT_RADIO_WITH_TEXT, radioButtonText, componentType));
134      radioComponent(componentType).select(radioButtonText);
135   }
136
137   /**
138    * Selects a radio button identified by a locator, using the specified {@link RadioComponentType}.
139    *
140    * @param componentType      the radio component type.
141    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator referencing the radio button.
142    */
143   @Override
144   public void select(final RadioComponentType componentType, final By radioButtonLocator) {
145      LogUi.step(String.format(SELECT_RADIO_WITH_LOCATOR, radioButtonLocator, componentType));
146      radioComponent(componentType).select(radioButtonLocator);
147   }
148
149   /**
150    * Checks if a radio button is enabled within the specified container, identified by text.
151    *
152    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
153    * @param container       the container holding the radio button.
154    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
155    * @return true if enabled, otherwise false.
156    */
157   @Override
158   public boolean isEnabled(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container,
159                            final String radioButtonText) {
160      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_ENABLED_CONTAINER, radioButtonText, container, componentType));
161      return radioComponent(componentType).isEnabled(container, radioButtonText);
162   }
163
164   /**
165    * Checks if a radio button, identified by text, is enabled without specifying a container.
166    *
167    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
168    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
169    * @return true if enabled, otherwise false.
170    */
171   @Override
172   public boolean isEnabled(final RadioComponentType componentType, final String radioButtonText) {
173      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_ENABLED_TEXT, radioButtonText, componentType));
174      return radioComponent(componentType).isEnabled(radioButtonText);
175   }
176
177   /**
178    * Checks if a radio button identified by a locator is enabled.
179    *
180    * @param componentType      the radio component type.
181    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator referencing the radio button.
182    * @return true if enabled, otherwise false.
183    */
184   @Override
185   public boolean isEnabled(final RadioComponentType componentType, final By radioButtonLocator) {
186      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_ENABLED_LOCATOR, radioButtonLocator, componentType));
187      return radioComponent(componentType).isEnabled(radioButtonLocator);
188   }
189
190   /**
191    * Checks if a radio button is selected within the specified container, identified by text.
192    *
193    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
194    * @param container       the container holding the radio button.
195    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
196    * @return true if selected, otherwise false.
197    */
198   @Override
199   public boolean isSelected(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container,
200                             final String radioButtonText) {
201      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_SELECTED_CONTAINER, radioButtonText, container, componentType));
202      return radioComponent(componentType).isSelected(container, radioButtonText);
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Checks if a radio button, identified by text, is selected without specifying a container.
207    *
208    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
209    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
210    * @return true if selected, otherwise false.
211    */
212   @Override
213   public boolean isSelected(final RadioComponentType componentType, final String radioButtonText) {
214      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_SELECTED_TEXT, radioButtonText, componentType));
215      return radioComponent(componentType).isSelected(radioButtonText);
216   }
217
218   /**
219    * Checks if a radio button identified by a locator is selected.
220    *
221    * @param componentType      the radio component type.
222    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator referencing the radio button.
223    * @return true if selected, otherwise false.
224    */
225   @Override
226   public boolean isSelected(final RadioComponentType componentType, final By radioButtonLocator) {
227      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_SELECTED_LOCATOR, radioButtonLocator, componentType));
228      return radioComponent(componentType).isSelected(radioButtonLocator);
229   }
230
231   /**
232    * Checks if a radio button is visible within the specified container, identified by text.
233    *
234    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
235    * @param container       the container holding the radio button.
236    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
237    * @return true if visible, otherwise false.
238    */
239   @Override
240   public boolean isVisible(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container,
241                            final String radioButtonText) {
242      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_VISIBLE_CONTAINER, radioButtonText, container, componentType));
243      return radioComponent(componentType).isVisible(container, radioButtonText);
244   }
245
246   /**
247    * Checks if a radio button, identified by text, is visible without specifying a container.
248    *
249    * @param componentType   the radio component type.
250    * @param radioButtonText the text of the radio button to check.
251    * @return true if visible, otherwise false.
252    */
253   @Override
254   public boolean isVisible(final RadioComponentType componentType, final String radioButtonText) {
255      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_VISIBLE_TEXT, radioButtonText, componentType));
256      return radioComponent(componentType).isVisible(radioButtonText);
257   }
258
259   /**
260    * Checks if a radio button identified by a locator is visible.
261    *
262    * @param componentType      the radio component type.
263    * @param radioButtonLocator the locator referencing the radio button.
264    * @return true if visible, otherwise false.
265    */
266   @Override
267   public boolean isVisible(final RadioComponentType componentType, final By radioButtonLocator) {
268      LogUi.step(String.format(CHECK_RADIO_VISIBLE_LOCATOR, radioButtonLocator, componentType));
269      return radioComponent(componentType).isVisible(radioButtonLocator);
270   }
271
272   /**
273    * Retrieves the text of the currently selected radio button within a container.
274    *
275    * @param componentType the radio component type.
276    * @param container     the container holding the radio buttons.
277    * @return the text of the selected radio button, or an empty string if none is selected.
278    */
279   @Override
280   public String getSelected(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container) {
281      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_SELECTED_RADIO_CONTAINER, container, componentType));
282      return radioComponent(componentType).getSelected(container);
283   }
284
285   /**
286    * Retrieves the text of the currently selected radio button within a container specified by a locator.
287    *
288    * @param componentType    the radio component type.
289    * @param containerLocator the locator referencing the container holding the radio buttons.
290    * @return the text of the selected radio button, or an empty string if none is selected.
291    */
292   @Override
293   public String getSelected(final RadioComponentType componentType, final By containerLocator) {
294      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_SELECTED_RADIO_LOCATOR, containerLocator, componentType));
295      return radioComponent(componentType).getSelected(containerLocator);
296   }
297
298   /**
299    * Retrieves a list of all available radio button texts in the specified container.
300    *
301    * @param componentType the radio component type.
302    * @param container     the container holding the radio buttons.
303    * @return a list of all radio button texts.
304    */
305   @Override
306   public List<String> getAll(final RadioComponentType componentType, final SmartWebElement container) {
307      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_ALL_RADIOS_CONTAINER, container, componentType));
308      return radioComponent(componentType).getAll(container);
309   }
310
311   /**
312    * Retrieves a list of all available radio button texts in a container specified by a locator.
313    *
314    * @param componentType    the radio component type.
315    * @param containerLocator the locator referencing the container holding the radio buttons.
316    * @return a list of all radio button texts.
317    */
318   @Override
319   public List<String> getAll(final RadioComponentType componentType, final By containerLocator) {
320      LogUi.step(String.format(GET_ALL_RADIOS_LOCATOR, containerLocator, componentType));
321      return radioComponent(componentType).getAll(containerLocator);
322   }
323
324   /**
325    * Inserts (selects) a radio button based on the first passed value. Used by the
326    * {@link Insertion} interface.
327    *
328    * @param componentType the {@link ComponentType} identifying the radio component.
329    * @param locator       the locator for the container or element.
330    * @param values        an array of objects, expected to contain at least one string representing the radio text.
331    */
332   @Override
333   public void insertion(final ComponentType componentType, final By locator, final Object... values) {
334      if (!(componentType instanceof RadioComponentType radioType)) {
335         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Component type needs to be from: RadioComponentType.");
336      }
337      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_RADIO_VALUES_LOCATOR, Arrays.toString(values), componentType, locator));
338      select(radioType, locator);
339   }
340
341   /**
342    * Retrieves or creates the {@link Radio} instance for the specified component type.
343    *
344    * @param componentType the radio component type.
345    * @return the {@link Radio} instance associated with the given component type.
346    */
347   private Radio radioComponent(final RadioComponentType componentType) {
348      return getOrCreateComponent(componentType);
349   }
350
351}
